article.headline: Bethune-Cookman 80, Warner Southern 72
article.story: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. (AP) -- Dewayne Pettus scored 20 points and Jimmy Hudson added 19 to propel Bethune-Cookman College past Warner Southern College 80-72 Monday. Pettus scored 15 points in the first half when the Wildcats (2-1) fought from a 12-point deficit to take a 13-point lead at halftime. Brandon Hamilton claimed 16 points to pace the visiting Royals (3-2). Preston Adams scored 12 points and Mike Tolliver scored 10. Kevan Creppy scored 11 points and a game-high nine rebounds for Bethune-Cookman which shot 52.9 percent from the field and posted a rebounding edge 33-29. Adams led Warner to a 15-3 command five minutes into the game. Bethune-Cookman edged to within nine points, 22-13, with 8:14 left before halftime. Then Bethune-Cookman dominated with a Pettus-fueled 30-8 run that led to a 43-30 halftime advantage. Warner, which had hit four of its first five shots, got one field goal during the last 9:45 of the first period. Warner used an 11-1 stretch at the start of the second half to get to within three, 44-41, at 16:14.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
